availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Daffron (Edmonson County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier in the 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ludy Daffron. Father of Lucinda Daffron and Susan V. L. Daffron. Laborer in Edmonson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in Company B 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from February 13, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in Company H 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to June 30, 1865. Served in Company H 26th Kentucky Veteran Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from June 30, 1865 to July 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 53.
